title: To Thomas Atkins
author: Rudyard Kipling
content:
PRELUDE TO "BARRACK-ROOM BALLADS"
    I have made for you a song    And it may be right or wrong,
But only you can tell me if it's true.    I have tried for to explain    Both your pleasure and your pain,
And, Thomas, here's my best respects to you!
    O there'll surely come a day    When they'll give you all your pay,
And treat you as a Christian ought to do;    So, until that day comes round,    Heaven keep you safe and sound,
And, Thomas, here's my best respects to you!
